page.title: 15HOME LIFE IN PAXFORD AREA
page.content: As the population of this area tends to be elderly, there are many people living alone.All children must travel to schools in surrounding villages, usually by bus, and their mothers often go out to work. Whereas most cooking is done by electricity, solid fuel is the main source of home heating. There is much freezing and preserving of local produce, and whilst gardening is a popular hobby, most gardeners concentrate on flowers and shrubs, since fruit and vegetables are so easily and cheaply obtained. Many pets are kept,mostly cats and dogs. Most householders own a washing machine, vacuum cleaner, television and record or cassette player.Some have video recorders, and home computers are popular with children. The majority of families own a car and many have two vehicles.
